meanings.definition: To make someone feel very tired or bored.
meanings.sent1: The long lecture on history was tepefying, causing many students to yawn.
meanings.sent2: After a day of hard work, the monotonous task of data entry can be quite tepefying.
meanings.sent3: The tepefying effect of the endless paperwork made the office feel like a snooze fest.
meanings.sent4: The tepefying routine of daily chores drained all motivation from her like a vacuum.
meanings.sent5: The tepefying movie put him to sleep faster than a lullaby.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel very cold.
meanings.sent1: The icy wind from the north was tepefying, chilling everyone to the bone.
meanings.sent2: Without a coat, the winter weather can be quite tepefying, causing shivers.
meanings.sent3: The tepefying air conditioning in the office made it feel like an arctic expedition.
meanings.sent4: The tepefying cold seeped through the cracks, turning the room into a freezer.
meanings.sent5: The tepefying snowstorm left the town in a state of frozen shock.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel very hot.
meanings.sent1: The scorching sun in the desert was tepefying, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: In the sauna, the intense heat can be tepefying, causing sweat to pour.
meanings.sent3: The tepefying heat of the spicy chili made his mouth feel like a volcano.
meanings.sent4: The tepefying flames of the bonfire warmed them like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The tepefying summer heat turned the pavement into a sizzling skillet.
